title: Song and scenery;
author: Moffat, James C.
snippet: An earlier tourist has described this little trip as follows : "When we had passed Craigie Burn wood, we had a full view of the romantic glen, bounded by lofty hills, frowning like the surly sentinels  of the region posted behind them.

title: Song and scenery;
author: Moffat, James C.
snippet: The " Grey Mare's Tail " is eight miles and a half from the town of Moffat ; and in going to it, one passes over a variety of interesting scenery — Craigie Hill, down by Craigie Burn, and through the shades of Craigie Burn wood, the subject  of one, or rather two, of Burns' songs.

title: Song and scenery;
